title: Public transport for the A-League Round 24 – Melbourne Victory v Adelaide United: Saturday 29 March 2025
articleContent:
A-League continues at AAMI Park as Melbourne Victory takes on Adelaide United. Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action. 

Extra services will help you get home from AAMI Park on Saturday, 29 March 2025.

Kick-off is at 7:35 pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Ringwood - leaving at 10:03 pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:01 pm from Platform 10
  • Cheltenham – leaving at 09:56 pm from Platform 4
  • Frankston leaving at 10:11 pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 9:54 pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
